abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and institutional development impacts
            were substantial, accomplished by satisfactory performances
            by both the Bank and Borrower. Lessons convey the following.
            Project readiness is essential, especially in the case of
            projects with demanding reform agendas, and, it is
            reinforced that thorough project preparation, ensuring the
            scope of the project is within the capacity of the
            implementing agency to manage is critical, including a
            detailed preparation of the Project implementation plan
            (PIP). Furthermore, stable leadership in the implementing
            agency is required if reforms are to be implemented
            successfully. Similarly, a district-based, community-driven
            model for rural water supply and sanitation, and catchment
            management is powerful and effective in scaling up and
            ensuring sustainability. In so doing it is important to
            provide adequate start-up time to introduce concepts, and
            build implementation capacity at the district and community
            levels. Finally, the establishment of efficient,
            commercially-oriented urban water utilities requires proper
            incentive structures, and professional independent review
            and monitoring.
